TempSED 0.0
  • Get started
  • Reference

    Functions to retrieve parameters, porosity, depth and sediment grid, irrigation and bioturbation, for the TempSED model.

    TempSED_getparms.Rd

    TempSED_getparms, TempSED_getdepth, TempSED_getdx retrieve the parameters, sediment depths and layer thicknesses of TempSED model solutions.

    TempSED_getpor, TempSED_getirr retrieve the porosity, and irrigation profiles of TempSED model solutions.

    TempSED_getparms(out = NULL, as.vector = FALSE, which = NULL)
  TempSED_getdepth(out)
  TempSED_getgrid(out)
  TempSED_getdx(out)
  TempSED_getpor(out)
  TempSED_getirr(out)

    Arguments

    out

    an output object returned by TempSED_run1D. If NULL, TempSED_getparms will return the default (parameter) values.

    as.vector

    if TRUE will return the parameter vector, else a data.frame that also contains the units.

    which

    if not NULL, a vector with names of the variables/parameters to return.

    Author

    Karline Soetaert

    References

    Soetaert K, PMJ Herman and JJ Middelburg, 1996a. A model of early diagenetic processes from the shelf to abyssal depths. Geochimica Cosmochimica Acta, 60(6):1019-1040.

    Soetaert K, PMJ Herman and JJ Middelburg, 1996b. Dynamic response of deep-sea sediments to seasonal variation: a model. Limnol. Oceanogr. 41(8): 1651-1668.

    See also

    TempSED_get0Dvars. TempSED_getparms. plot.TempSEDdyn.

    Examples

    
# defaults
  defparms  <- TempSED_getparms(as.vector = TRUE)
  defparms
#>               S          em_air     em_sediment    albedo_water albedo_sediment 
#>         35.0000          0.8000          0.9500          0.0500          0.1500 
#>        kd_water     kd_sediment        cp_water        cp_solid        tc_water 
#>          1.0000       1000.0000       3994.0000       1000.0000          0.6000 
#>        tc_solid   density_water   density_solid         stanton          dalton 
#>          2.1000       1024.0000       2500.0000          0.0010          0.0014 

# a run to work with  
  defdyn    <- TempSED_run1D()

  out <- TempSED_run1D(parms     = list(cp_solid = 500))

# grid used for outputs

  plot(TempSED_getpor(out), TempSED_getdepth(out), 
       ylim = c(0.10, 0), 
       type = "l", 
       ylab = "m", xlab = "-", main = "porosity")
